info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 5:12PM EDT until July 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 511 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cheshire, or near Pittsfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Cheshire, Savoy, Berkshire, Dalton, Lanesborough, Hinsdale, Windsor, Peru, Cheshire Harbor, Arnoldville, Town Crest Village, Lakeview Terrace, The Boulders, Adams Junction, Yankee Orchards, Stearnsville, Victory Hill, Farnams and Pontoosuc. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
